name: ListTrustedOrigins
description:
Retrieve all trusted origins from Okta.

This tool should be used to obtain a list of all trusted origins configured in Okta. It is useful for managing security settings by identifying domains that are trusted by your Okta instance.

parameters.name: search_prefix_string
parameters.description: A search string to filter origins, matching the beginning of `name` or `origin`.

value_schema.description: A search string that prefix matches against the `name` and `origin`

parameters.name: filter_trusted_origins
parameters.description: Filter trusted origins using expressions for properties like `name`, `origin`, `status`, and `type`.

value_schema.description: [Filter](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#filter) trusted origins with a supported expression for a subset of properties. You can filter on the following properties: `name`, `origin`, `status`, and `type` (type of scopes).

parameters.name: cursor_after_prior_request
parameters.description: Use this cursor to continue listing from where the previous request left off.

value_schema.description: After cursor provided by a prior request

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of trusted origins to return in the response.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the okta API.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A search string that prefix matches against the `name` and `origin`

value_schema.description: A search string that prefix matches against the `name` and `origin`

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: [Filter](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#filter) trusted origins with a supported expression for a subset of properties. You can filter on the following properties: `name`, `origin`, `status`, and `type` (type of scopes).

value_schema.description: [Filter](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#filter) trusted origins with a supported expression for a subset of properties. You can filter on the following properties: `name`, `origin`, `status`, and `type` (type of scopes).

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: After cursor provided by a prior request

value_schema.description: After cursor provided by a prior request

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
